briefdescription.para: Fast but not a very good image quality. Good for fast animations.
Slower but better image quality. Good for static representation of a scaled image.
Rendering algorithm to use when scaling the bitmap.

detaileddescription.para: Nearest neighbor simply finds the closest pixel in the source bitmap. Bilinear interpolation averages 4 pixels to find a much better pixel representation, and is therefore slower than the Nearest neighbor algorithm.

briefdescription.para: An alpha value that is applied to the entire image.

Draw this drawable.

detaileddescription.para: It is a requirement that the draw implementation does not draw outside the region specified by invalidatedArea.

parameterdescription.para: The sub-region of this drawable that needs to be redrawn, expressed in coordinates relative to its parent (e.g. for a complete redraw, invalidatedArea will be (0, 0, width, height).

briefdescription.para: Gets the current alpha value of the widget.

detaileddescription.para: The alpha value is in range 255 (solid) to 0 (invisible).

briefdescription.para: Gets the Bitmap currently assigned to the TextureMapper widget.

simplesect.para: The current Bitmap of the widget.

briefdescription.para: Gets bitmap position x coordinate.
Gets bitmap position y coordinate.
Gets camera distance.
Gets camera x coordinate.
Gets camera y coordinate.
Gets transformation origo x coordinate.
Gets transformation origo y coordinate.
Gets transformation origo z coordinate.
Gets the algorithm used when rendering.
Gets the scale of the image.
Get (the largest possible) rectangle that is guaranteed to be solid (opaque).

detaileddescription.para: This information is important, as any Drawable underneath the solid area does not need to be drawn.

simplesect.para: The solid rectangle part of the Drawable.

The rectangle returned must be relative to upper left corner of the Drawable, meaning that a completely solid widget should return the full size Rect(0, 0, getWidth(), getHeight()). If no area can be guaranteed to be solid, an empty Rect(0, 0, 0, 0) must be returned. Failing to return the correct rectangle may result in errors on the display.

briefdescription.para: Get the x coordinate of the top left corner of the transformed bitmap.
Get the x coordinate of the top right corner of the transformed bitmap.
Get the x coordinate of the bottom right of the transformed bitmap.
Get the x coordinate of the bottom left corner of the transformed bitmap.

Get the y coordinate of the top right corner of the transformed bitmap.
Get the y coordinate of the bottom right corner of the transformed bitmap.
Get the y coordinate of the bottom left corner of the transformed bitmap.
Get the y angle.
Get the z coordinate of the top left corner of the transformed bitmap.
Get the z coordinate of the top right corner of the transformed bitmap.
Get the z coordinate of the bottom right corner of the transformed bitmap.
Get the z coordinate of the bottom left corner of the transformed bitmap.
Get the z angle.
Sets the opacity (alpha value).

detaileddescription.para: This can be used to fade it away by gradually decreasing the alpha value from 255 (solid) to 0 (invisible).

simplesect.para: The user code must call invalidate() in order to update the display.

briefdescription.para: Sets the bitmap for this TextureMapper and updates the width and height of this widget to match those of the Bitmap.

simplesect.para: The user code must call invalidate() in order to update the image on the display.

briefdescription.para: Sets the position of the bitmap within the TextureMapper.

detaileddescription.para: The bitmap is clipped with respect to the dimensions of the TextureMapper widget.

briefdescription.para: Sets the position of the bitmap within the TextureMapper.

detaileddescription.para: The bitmap is clipped with respect to the dimensions of the TextureMapper widget.

briefdescription.para: Sets the camera coordinate.

parameterdescription.para: The x coordinate for the camera.
The y coordinate for the camera.

briefdescription.para: Sets camera distance.

detaileddescription.para: If the given value is below TextureMapper::MINIMAL_CAMERA_DISTANCE, it will be set to TextureMapper::MINIMAL_CAMERA_DISTANCE.

briefdescription.para: Sets the transformation origo (center).
Sets the transformation origo (center) in two dimensions.
Sets the render algorithm to be used.

parameterdescription.para: The algorithm to use when rendering.

briefdescription.para: Sets the scale of the image.
Updates the angles of the image.

detaileddescription.para: The area covered by the image before and after changing the angles is invalidated, which is the smallest required rectangle.

simplesect.para: updateXAngle, updateYAngle, updateZAngle, getXAngle, getYAngle, getZAngle

briefdescription.para: Updates the x angle given by xAngle.
Updates the y angle given by yAngle.
Updates the z angle given by zAngle.
Transform the bitmap using the supplied origo, scale, rotation and camera.

detaileddescription.para: This method is called by all the methods that manipulate origo, scale, rotation and camera.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Rect &invalidatedArea, uint16_t *fb, const float *triangleXs, const float *triangleYs, const float *triangleZs, const float *triangleUs, const float *triangleVs) const
memberdef.name: drawTriangle

briefdescription.para: The TextureMapper will draw the transformed bitmap by drawing two triangles.

detaileddescription.para: One triangle is created from the points 0,1,2 and the other triangle from the points 1,2,3. The triangle is drawn using the x,y,z values from each point along with the u,v coordinates in the bitmap associated with each point.

briefdescription.para: Gets bounding rectangle of the transformed bitmap.

detaileddescription.para: This is the smallest possible rectangle which covers the image of the bitmap after applying scale and rotation.

briefdescription.para: Returns the rendering variant based on the bitmap format, alpha value and rendering algorithm.
The TextureMapper widget displays a transformed image.

detaileddescription.para: It can be used to generate effects where an image should be rotated in two or three dimensions.

The image can be freely scaled and rotated in three dimensions. The scaling and rotation is done around the adjustable origin. A virtual camera is applied to the rendered image yielding a perspective impression. The amount of perspective impression can be adjusted. The transformed image is clipped according to the dimensions of the TextureMapper widget. In order to make the image fully visible the TextureMapper should be large enough to accommodate the transformed image, which may be larger than the raw image.

simplesect.para: The drawing of this widget is not trivial and typically has a significant performance penalty. The number of pixels drawn, the presence of global alpha or per pixel alpha inflicts the computation and should be considered.
This widget does not support 1 bit per pixel color depth.
